newsitem.title: USA: IMM currency futures close mixed.
newsitem.headline: IMM currency futures close mixed.

text.p: IMM currency futures closed mixed, as the summer doldrums set into the forex market amid continued comments on European monetary union from European officials, traders said.
A senior associate of German Chancellor Helmut Kohl said France and Germany must meet soon to clear up differences on the planned single European currency and economic policy.

His comments underscored recent debates within Kohl's ruling alliance and kept mark buyers from becoming too enthusiastic, they said. September marks rose to $0.5782 in reaction to weaker than expected U.S. economic data.
The U.S. June National Association of Purchasing Management index and U.S. May construction spending numbers were lower than expected.
The data solidified expectations that the Federal Open Market Committee will leave interest rates unchanged at its two-day meeting this week.
U.S. Deputy Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said there was no inflation in sight despite a strong U.S. economy.
Summers also said the dollar was "in a very strong position" and that financial markets would be fine if the United States maintained solid fundamentals.
September marks dipped to $0.5753, but held above the contract low set overnight at $0.5750.
September sterling held losses on liquidation ahead of the U.K. budget announcement on July 2, while September Swiss francs edged near the four-month low of $0.6868.

Meanwhile, Mexican peso futures continued to rally, contrary to most trade expectations for declines ahead of Mexico's July 6 mid-term elections. However, profit-taking was nowhere to be found as September pesos rose to $0.122525.

At the end of pit trade, September yen was off $0.000027 at $0.008799, marks were down $0.0009 at $0.5756, Swiss francs fell $0.0023 to $0.6885, sterling lost $0.0050 at $1.6556, Canadian dollars were up $0.0008 at $0.7284, Australian dollars were $0.0020 lower at $0.7522 and Mexican pesos were up $0.000475 at $0.122475. ((Chicago Derivatives desk 312-408-8750))
